Pre-Game Insights: George Bailey has confirmed that Steve Smith won't make the playing 11 of the Australian team against New Zealand in their first match of the Super-12 stage.
Mitchell Marsh is set to be the number three of the side, and the emergence of Tim David in the lower middle order has cemented his place as well.
The Australian team will rely on its all-rounders yet again, and the trio of Mitch Marsh, Glenn Maxwell, and Marcus Stoinis will play a vital role.
Others: The Australian team is one of the favourites to lift the trophy in their home conditions as well.
The fitness of Australia's all-rounders will play a huge part in their World Cup campaign going forward.
David Warner is looking fine, and they would not have played him in the warm-up game against India regardless of his injury.
